Model evaluation in experimental plots

Miquel De Cáceres (CREAF), Víctor Granda (CREAF), Rafael Poyatos (CREAF), Nicolas Martin-StPaul (INRAE)

2024-03-12

Source: vignettes/evaluation/StandLevelEvaluation.Rmd
StandLevelEvaluation.Rmd

Introduction

This document presents medfate (ver. 4.0.0) model evaluation results at stand-level, using data from a set of 17 experimental forest plots. The main source of observed data are SAPFLUXNET database (Poyatos et al. 2021) and FLUXNET 2015 dataset (Pastorello et al. 2020).

Forest water balance simulations (i.e. function spwb()) have been conducted using the three transpiration modes (i.e. Granier, Sperry or Cochard). Only soil characteristics have been tuned, but calibration exercises have not been conducted. When available, however, leaf area to sapwood area ratios have been used. Thus, the evaluation is meant to be more or less representative of simulations with default species-level trait data.

List of sites

Plot Country Stand SAPFLUXNET FLUXNET/ICOS
Puéchabon France Dense evergreen forest dominated by Q. ilex FRA_PUE
Mitra II Portugal Evergreen forest dominated by Quercus ilex subsp. rotundifolia PRT_MIT PT-Mi1
Hesse France Naturally regenerated, managed beech forest FRA_HES_HE2_NON FR-Hes
Yatir Israel Pinus halepensis managed plantation ISR_YAT_YAT
Rinconada Spain Young, homogeneous, Quercus pyrenaica regrowth forest ESP_RIN
Vallcebre (Cal Barrol) Spain Semi-deciduous sub-Mediterranean oak forest ESP_VAL_BAR
Vallcebre (Cal Sort) Spain Pinus sylvestris forest in a terraced area ESP_VAL_SOR
Fontainebleau-Barbeau France Mixed deciduous forest FRA_FON FR-Fon
Davos Seehornwald Switzerland Subalpine coniferous (spruce) forest CHE_DAV_SEE CH-Dav
EucFACE Australia Eucalyptus trees in ambient (control) plots of a CO2 enrichment experiment AUS_RIC_EUC_ELE AU-Cum
Prades (Tillar valley) Spain Mixed forest with P. sylvestris (overstory) Q. ilex (midstory) ESP_TIL_MIX
Wombat Australia Mixed eucalyptus forest AUS_WOM AU-Wom
Font-Blanche France Mixed forest with P. halepensis and Q. ilex FR-Fbn
Can Balasc Spain Mixed forest dominated by Q. ilex ESP_CAN
Alto Tajo (Armallones) Spain Sparse mixed forest dominated by three species ESP_ALT_ARM
Ronda (Pilones) Spain Mixed gimnosperm forest dominated by Abies pinsapo ESP_RON_PIL
Morgan Mornoe state forest USA Mixed temperate forest USA_MOR_SF US-MMS

Evaluation variables

Variable Level Observation source Units
Total evapotranspiration Stand FLUXNET / ICOS mm
Latent heat turbulent flux Stand FLUXNET / ICOS MJ/m2
Gross primary productivity Stand FLUXNET / ICOS gC/m2
Soil moisture content (topsoil) Stand SAPFLUXNET / FLUXNET / ICOS % vol.
Transpiration per leaf area Plant SAPFLUXNET l/m2
Predawn/midday leaf water potential Plant SAPFLUXNET (addition) MPa

Structure of site reports

The following contains as many sections as forest stands included in the evaluation. The following sub-sections are reported for each stand:

  1. General information: General information about the site, topography, soil and climate, as well as data sources used.
  2. Model inputs: Description of model inputs (vegetation, soil, custom species parameters and parameterization remarks).
  3. Evaluation results: Evaluation results are presented for variables with available measurements.
